parameters.name: accounts
parameters.description: The list of Amazon Web Services accounts for which log sources are displayed. (string) ---

parameters.name: regions
parameters.description: The list of Regions for which log sources are displayed. (string) ---

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The list of sources for which log sources are displayed. (dict) --- The supported source types from which logs and events are collected in Amazon Security Lake. For a list of supported Amazon Web Services services, see the Amazon Security Lake User Guide. awsLogSource (dict) --- Amazon Security Lake supports log and event collection for natively supported Amazon Web Services services. For more information, see the Amazon Security Lake User Guide. sourceName (string) --- The name for a Amazon Web Services source. This must be a Regionally unique value. sourceVersion (string) --- The version for a Amazon Web Services source. customLogSource (dict) --- Amazon Security Lake supports custom source types. attributes (dict) --- The attributes of a third-party custom source. crawlerArn (string) --- The ARN of the Glue crawler. databaseArn (string) --- The ARN of the Glue database where results are written, such as: arn:aws:daylight:us-east-1::database/sometable/*. tableArn (string) --- The ARN of the Glue table. provider (dict) --- The details of the log provider for a third-party custom source. location (string) --- The location of the partition in the Amazon S3 bucket for Security Lake. roleArn (string) --- The ARN of the IAM role to be used by the entity putting logs into your custom source partition. Security Lake will apply the correct access policies to this role, but you must first manually create the trust policy for this role. The IAM role name must start with the text --Security Lake'. The IAM role must trust the logProviderAccountId to assume the role. sourceName (string) --- The name for a third-party custom source. sourceVersion (string) --- The version for a third-party custom source. This must be a Regionally unique value.

nested_params.name: awsLogSource
nested_params.description: Amazon Security Lake supports log and event collection for natively supported Amazon Web Services services. For more information, see the Amazon Security Lake User Guide.

nested_params.name: sourceName
nested_params.description: The name for a Amazon Web Services source. This must be a Regionally unique value.

nested_params.name: sourceVersion
nested_params.description: The version for a Amazon Web Services source. This must be a Regionally unique value.

nested_params.name: customLogSource
nested_params.description: Amazon Security Lake supports custom source types. For more information, see the Amazon Security Lake User Guide.

nested_params.name: attributes
nested_params.description: The attributes of a third-party custom source.

nested_params.name: crawlerArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the Glue crawler.

nested_params.name: databaseArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the Glue database where results are written, such as: arn:aws:daylight:us-east-1::database/sometable/*.

nested_params.name: tableArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the Glue table.

nested_params.name: provider
nested_params.description: The details of the log provider for a third-party custom source.

nested_params.name: location
nested_params.description: The location of the partition in the Amazon S3 bucket for Security Lake.

nested_params.name: roleArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the IAM role to be used by the entity putting logs into your custom source partition. Security Lake will apply the correct access policies to this role, but you must first manually create the trust policy for this role. The IAM role name must start with the text --Security Lake'. The IAM role must trust the logProviderAccountId to assume the role.

nested_params.name: sourceName
nested_params.description: The name for a third-party custom source. This must be a Regionally unique value.

nested_params.name: sourceVersion
nested_params.description: The version for a third-party custom source. This must be a Regionally unique value.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. You can repeat the call using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

nested_items.name: sources
nested_items.description: The list of log sources in your organization that send data to the data lake.

nested_items.description: Specify the account from which you want to collect logs.
